item.title: The Switch 2's Future Zelda Game Has a Perfect Way to Inherit BotW, TotK's Innovation
item.description: The Switch 2 is already shaping up to have a strong lineup of games, but one big question still lingers—when will we see the next mainline Legend of Zelda? After the massive success of Breath of the Wild and Tears of the Kingdom, another entry feels inevitable, especially with updated versions of those two games already confirmed for Nintendo’s next console. Although Nintendo hasn’t shared any details yet, it's a safe bet that the Switch 2’s new Joy-Con controllers—especially their unique “mouse mode”—will influence whatever comes next.

item.title: Destiny 2: Xur Exotic Armor, Weapon, and Recommendations for May 16
item.description:
Summary

  • Xur is back in Destiny 2 with new gear for players to explore for a limited time.
  • For exotic armor, Xur has One-Eyed Mask, Aeon Soul, and Knucklehead Radar.
  • Xur's exotic weapons include a new Hawkmoon, The Huckleberry, Sunshot, and The Prospector.

Xur has returned again to Destiny 2 , complete with new exotic and legendary gear for players to check out for a limited time. Destiny 2 has had its fair share of criticisms and controversies over the years and, unfortunately, Bungie found itself in another one this week at reset. Fans were upset when they discovered more timegating had been applied to the Rites of the Nine activity, essentially locking each dungeon into a three-week cycle. Thankfully, Bungie moved very quickly and announced major changes to Destiny 2 's Rite of the Nine activity, making the schedule friendlier and the event more rewarding overall.

As the Heavy Metal event for Destiny 2 finally comes to a close, Trials of Osiris also makes its return after a couple of weeks off. To reward player patience, Bungie also announced that players will be earning double rep this weekend. Unfortunately for Osiris fans, Iron Banner returns at reset next week, so get those matches in now as the weekend playlist will be put back on the shelf for another week.

With the weekend finally here, the exotic merchant Xur has returned with a new inventory of gear for Destiny 2 players. Follow this guide for his current weekend location, news on his exotic cipher quest, as well as a review of all the exotic and legendary gear he's brought for the weekend of May 16, 2025.

Where is Xur?

Xur has now taken up permanent residence in the Bazaar area inside The Tower, so there's no more hunting when the weekend comes around.

Since the Bazaar is located between both fast travel points, players can pick either one to load into. Head into the area where Ikora and Hawthorne are hanging out and look for the Ramen Shop towards the back wall. While facing the shop, the alley hiding Xur is to the right.

Destiny 2 Exotic Class Armor

Xur's role has continued to expand and evolve over the years. Alongside The Final Shape expansion, Xur's inventory in Destiny 2 expanded even more, moving back to Strange Coins as the currency of choice, rank rewards, resources, and of course, armor and weapons.

Aeon Soul - Warlock gauntlets

Exotic Perks :

  • Sect of Force temporarily increases player reload speed and weapon swap speed after rapid precision hits. Taking down a champion or boss also gives nearby fireteam members a burst of grenade and melee energy.
  • Sect of Vigor gives the player class energy when teammates die, then gains full class energy after reviving. When nearby players cast their super, allies gain a burst of healing.
  • Sect of Insight has a chance to drop an orb of power after precision weapon takedowns. When using a finisher on an elite enemy, special ammo is dropped. Using a finisher on a boss or miniboss, heavy ammo drops instead.

Unfortunately, the Aeon SOul has returned after being available just two weeks ago. Not much has changed at all, so it still isn't a must buy.

Stat Values (67 Total):

  • Mobility +6
  • Resilience +17
  • Recovery +13
  • Discipline +6
  • Intellect +10
  • Strength +15

Knucklehead Radar - Hunter helmet

Exotic Perk :

  • Upgraded Sensor Pack - Provides radar while you're aiming. Enhances your radar resolution while crouched. Visually marks targets. Deals more damage to low-health marked targets. Provides a small benefit to the airborne effectiveness stat of all weapons.

It's back for a second week in a row, this time with a slightly better overall stat line.

Stat Values (67 Total):

  • Mobility +21
  • Resilience +11
  • Recovery +2
  • Discipline +2
  • Intellect +24
  • Strength +7

One-Eyed Mask - Titan helmet

Exotic Perk :

  • Vengeance - Highlights the target who dares to damage you. Track down and destroy them for an overshield.

A former beast in the Crucible, the One-Eyed Mask has seen its fair share of nerfs over the years to bring it back in line. It's still solid for PvP, but there are much better options these days.

Stat Values (67 total):

  • Mobility +11
  • Resilience +13
  • Recovery +10
  • Discipline +2
  • Intellect +12
  • Strength +19

Xur Inventory Items

Year 7 in Destiny 2 has upgraded Xur's inventory, adding a true rank progression system, rewards, as well as focusing options. Xur also has more than just weapons and armor as well, including:

  • Deathbringer Catalyst
  • Heir Apparent Catalyst
  • The Xurfboard (Skimmer Board Vehicle)
  • Essentialism/Stoicism/Solipsism OR Exotic Cipher
  • Exotic Engram
  • Enhancement Prism
  • Glimmer
  • Enhancement Core
  • Gambit Engram
  • Strange Gift (Random Item for 1 Strange Coin)

Xur's Exotic Weapons

Year 7's Xur revamp has also added the ability to offer multiple exotic weapons in one visit. Here is what Xur has this weekend:

Hawkmoon - Hand Cannon

  • Paracausal Shot - Final blows and precision hits with Hawkmoon grant stacks of Paracausal Charge. The final round in the magazine deals bonus damage based on the number of stacks. Stowing Hawkmoon on the final round removes this bonus.
  • Arrowhead Brake
  • Alloy Magazine
  • Hip-Fire Grip
  • Textured Grip

The Huckleberry - Submachine Gun

  • Ride the Bull - Increases rate of fire and recoil while you're holding down the trigger. Final blows dealt with this weapon reload the magazine.
  • Rampage - Kills with this weapon temporarily grant increased damage. Stacks 3x.
  • Fluted Barrel
  • Ricochet Rounds
  • Short-Action Stock

Sunshot - Hand Cannon

  • Sunburn - This weapon fires explosive rounds and highlights targets that take damage from Sunshot.
  • Sun Blast - Targets defeated with Sunshot explode in Solar energy, scorching other nearby targets.
  • Chambered Compensator
  • Accurized Rounds
  • Textured Grip

The Prospector - Grenade Launcher

  • Excavation - Grenades spawn cluster bombs upon detonation. Defeating targets creates Arc explosions.
  • Full Auto Trigger System - Holding down the trigger will fire this weapon at full auto.
  • Volatile Launch
  • Augmented Drum
  • Hand-Laid Stock

Xur's Destiny 2 Legendary Armor and Weapons

Xur's Set of Legendary Armor and Weapons. All gear costs 50 Legendary Shards and 1000 Glimmer.

  • Extraordinary Rendition (Kinetic Submachine Gun)
  • Farewell (Kinetic Sidearm)
  • Persuader (Energy Sniper Rifle)
  • Distant Tumulus (Energy Sniper Rifle)
  • Falling Guillotine (Heavy Sword)
  • Negative Space (Heavy Sword)
  • Crown-Splitter/Quickfang/Eternity's Edge (Heavy Sword)
  • Strange Weapon Engram
  • Seventh Seraph Armor Set

Dive into the world of Destiny 2 to explore the mysteries of the solar system and experience responsive first-person shooter combat. Unlock powerful elemental abilities and collect unique gear to customize your Guardian's look and playstyle. An Immersive Story
You are a Guardian, defender of the Last City of humanity in a solar system under siege by infamous villains. Look to the stars and stand against the darkness. Your legend begins now.

item.title: Helldivers 2 Releases Emergency Update
item.description:
Summary

  • Arrowhead Game Studios has released an emergency hotfix for Helldivers 2.
  • It includes a fix for the ongoing Stratagem spawning glitch that has caused many players' games to suddenly crash.
  • The glitch has allowed players to spawn an infinite number of Stratagems at once, causing major problems.

Arrowhead Game Studios has released an emergency hotfix for Helldivers 2 , addressing a recently discovered glitch that allows players to spawn an infinite number of Stratagems at once, causing some players' games to crash. The recent issue has become a major headache for the game's community, with moderators on the Helldivers 2 subreddit banning clips or images of the exploit.

Released early last year, Helldivers 2 quickly became one of the best co-op games of 2024, with the game tasking teams of four with taking down massive bugs and killer robots using any number of interstellar weapons. The sequel to 2015's Helldivers has been praised for its gunplay and sense of humor, and while its initial launch was plagued with server and login issues, it managed to reach over 450,000 concurrent players on Steam shortly after its release. Helldivers 2 continues to see a steady stream of content updates and helpful patches, but unfortunately, these can sometimes have unexpected and catastrophic consequences.

An emergency hotfix for Helldivers 2 was announced on the game's official Discord server today (reported by VG247), which includes a fix for the ongoing Stratagem spawning glitch that has caused many players' games to suddenly crash. Following the release of Helldiver 2 's most recent major update earlier this week, some fans of the game discovered a way to spawn an infinite number of Stratagems at one time, with bad actors using this exploit to cause the game to crash. The new emergency hotfix addresses this issue alone, and players shouldn't have to worry about having their fun ruined by the bug going forward.

Helldivers 2 Emergency Hotfix Addresses Infinite Stratagem Spawning Glitch

The future of Helldivers 2 seems bright, with its developers dedicated to supporting the game and continuing to add polish to the live-service shooter. This month, Arrowhead CEO Shams Jorjani shared an interest in a Dead Space crossover, though whether this ever comes to fruition remains unclear. Many fans are also hoping for a future collaboration event with Warhammer 40K . Helldivers 2 has only crossed over with Killzone so far, but this has started a conversation about other properties that would be a good fit for the game.

While support for Helldivers 2 is set to continue, Arrowhead recently shared more about its next project, with the studio confirming that it would self-fund and self-publish its upcoming game, currently codenamed "Game 6." The title is reportedly in its early concept stage, and isn't scheduled to begin serious development until later in 2025.

item.title: Walk of Life Is a Competitive Life Sim With a Killer Sense of Humor [Hands-On Preview]
item.description:
Icelandic studio Porcelain Fortress began life as a VR gaming company back in 2016, but its first real hit wouldn't come until 2019's No Time to Relax . A fast-paced 4-player life sim, No Time to Relax tasked players with maintaining their avatar's physical needs and income, while also completing enough life events to earn them a higher score than their fellow players. After a few years of making browser games and board game companion apps, Porcelain Fortress is getting ready to return to the life sim genre with Walk of Life .

Intended to be the "dream version" of its competitive life sim formula (according to Porcelain Fortress founder Björn Elíeser Jónsson), Walk of Life takes the general framework of its 2019 spiritual predecessor and improves upon every conceivable aspect, from art style to UI to gameplay features. Game Rant got to see many of these improvements first hand, and even after just 30 minutes with the game, it's clear there's something special in the works here.

Walk of Life's Loop Is Frantic But Surprisingly Strategic

Walk of Life is best described as a sort of life sim/board game hybrid in which up to four players try to live the greatest life they possibly can within just 10 turns. Players are thrown onto a map that contains a wealth of buildings that range from banks to stores to apartments, gyms, and more. Each location has a set of unique activities inside.

During a turn, players will need to visit a variety of locations and complete activities that will improve their overall score or help to maintain their avatar's four gauges: health, hygiene, happiness, and stress. Completing an activity will advance the player's timer forward, and eventually end their turn. While there are certain things the player needs to do every turn, such as eating food in order to avoid a severe time penalty on the next go, most of their turn is free to be spent however they'd like. Players can get a job and earn money, go shopping, further their education, feed the birds at the park, and a plethora of other seemingly mundane everyday activities.

Once everyone's finished their final turn, scores will be awarded based on key factors like the player's stress level, their education, their living conditions, and any specific quests they've been able to complete along the way. Generally speaking, Walk of Life 's gameplay loop is fairly simple, and that simplicity should make the game incredibly accessible. Walk of Life 's pacing is also a key strength, with turns lasting only a maximum of a few minutes.

But despite Walk of Life 's frantic pace, there's a surprising amount of strategy at play in a given turn. Moving around the map also takes time away from the player, so they're encouraged to plan out the most important steps of their turn in advance. This time-based movement can also lead to some nail-biting moments of tension where players just barely make it to their desired location by the end of their turn.

Walk of Life's Irreverent Style Is Its Shining Feature

Taking just one glance at Walk of Life 's trailer or key art reveals the irreverent aesthetic and tone that the game wholeheartedly embraces at every turn. Every character avatar and portrait, every location backdrop, even every menu logo and font choice oozes with a vibrant cartoony freneticism.

This energetic art style goes hand in hand with Walk of Life 's tongue-in-cheek humor. Inspired by classic British shows like Blackadder and Monty Python , Walk of Life leans all the way into the absurdity of mundane everyday life, and pokes fun at the senseless nature of the daily rat race. Walk of Life 's frantic competitive gameplay, killer sense of humor, and unapologetically vibrant art style come together to create an experience that's already worth playing with friends. And with a few more months left to go before its projected Q3 2025 early access release date, there's plenty of time for it to become an even more well-rounded and polished game.

item.title: Sea of Stars: Throes of the Watchmaker - DLC Intro Trailer
item.description: Seas of Stars' Throes of the Watchmaker DLC shares its backstory with the official reveal of its opening cinematic movie. Throes of the Watchmaker launches in Sea of Stars on May 20 for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, and PC.
